title: Lion's Head Meatballs (Weeknight)
description: A streamlined version of classic Chinese lion's head meatballs: large, tender pork-and-ginger meatballs braised in a savory soy-ginger broth with napa cabbage. Quick enough for a weeknight while retaining rich umami, soft texture, and comforting bowl-style serving.

ingredients.display_name: scallions, white and green separated, thinly sliced

ingredients.notes: adds color, not necessary for flavor

ingredients.display_name: napa cabbage, core trimmed and leaves separated

ingredients.notes: mix cornstarch with 1 tbsp cold water to thicken at end

steps.text: Prepare aromatics and veg: peel and finely grate ginger, mince garlic, thinly slice scallions separating whites and greens, trim napa cabbage and separate leaves; set chicken broth heating on low so it's hot when added.

Make meatball mixture: in a large bowl combine ground pork, grated ginger, minced garlic, scallion whites, egg, cornstarch, soy sauce, shaoxing wine (if using), white pepper and salt. Mix thoroughly by hand or with a spoon until mixture is tacky and cohesive (do not overwork).

Portion meatballs: divide mixture into 8 large portions (about 100 g each) and shape gently into tight round meatballs using damp hands to prevent sticking. Keep meatballs chilled briefly if mixture becomes too soft.

Brown meatballs: heat oil in a wide heavy skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add meatballs in batches without crowding and brown evenly on all sides, about 2–3 minutes per side, turning carefully to keep shape. Transfer browned meatballs to a plate.

Build braising liquid: reduce heat to medium, add a splash of oil if pan is dry, add a portion of scallion whites and quick-sauté 30 seconds, then add light soy sauce, dark soy sauce (if using), sugar and pour in hot chicken broth. Stir to deglaze any browned bits.

Braise meatballs with cabbage: nestle browned meatballs into the broth, arrange napa cabbage leaves around and over meatballs so they are partly submerged, bring to a gentle simmer, cover, and braise until meatballs are cooked through and cabbage is tender, about 12–14 minutes.

Thicken and finish: remove lid, skim any excess foam, stir in cornstarch slurry and simmer uncovered 1–2 minutes until broth slightly thickens. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt or soy. Stir in sesame oil and scatter scallion greens over top.
Serve: ladle meatballs, cabbage and broth into bowls; garnish with remaining scallion greens. Serve with steamed rice or noodles if desired.
